request.description: List the slices under the current tenant

Goal – Create a new instance of a network slice according to an offer in a catalog. Sufficient information is provided to calculate the topology and resource requirements. All necessary resources are allocated.
Preconditions – The tenant has found a suitable service offering in the catalog. The tenant has a reference to the service template. The tenant knows which mandatory/optional parameters are required to complete the template. The tenant has decided the values for the parameters.
Request – The tenant submits a POST operation to the NSaaS endpoint, containing
•	Name of slice (of relevance to tenant only)
•	Reference to service template (URI to specific version of Network Slice Template)
•	Parameters (array of key-value pairs, according to names/structure as defined in template)
•	Callback address for success/failure notification (because this operation may need more than a few seconds to complete)
Response – The network provider returns an immediate response, which may be one of
•	Request is accepted, notification will be sent later to report success or failure
•	Invalid request (for example parameters do not match template)
•	Not allowed (for example tenant is not allowed to request this service type)
Notification (success) – The network provider submits a POST operation to the callback address, containing
•	Name of slice (as received in the request)
•	Network Slice ID
Notification (failure) – The network provider submits a POST operation to the callback address, containing
•	Name of slice (as received in the request)
•	Reason for failure (for example invalid request, not allowed)

response.name: Allocate Network -Create eMBB Slice for Emergency Services

body.raw:
{  
   "templateId":"3b1ca6e1-176a-4d63-9b11-91e6cf2a38c3",
   "name":"Create eMBB Slice for Emergency Service",
   "onFailure":"rollback",
   "description":"eMBB Slice for Emergency Service",
   "parameters":{  
      "location":"Rivarolo Ligure",
      "sliceActivationDate":"2019-04-26T06:00:00.511Z",
      "sliceExpirationDate":"2019-04-26T23:59:59.511Z",
      "sla":"Premium",
      "servicePriority":"High",
      "maxUE":10000,
      "enableCharging":"Yes",
      "enableMobility":"Yes"
   }
}

request.description:
Goal – Configure instance-specific data for an existing instance of a network slice. Any configuration data which was not defined during allocation is defined at this time (late binding). All related resources are configured and ready for activation.
Preconditions – The tenant has allocated a network slice instance and has received a Network Slice ID. The tenant wishes to configure some optional parameters which were not specified during allocation (late binding) or wishes to change some parameters which were specified during allocation.
Request – The tenant submits a PUT operation to the network slice instance endpoint, containing
•	Parameters (array of key-value pairs, according to names/structure as defined in template)
•	SLA Description
•	Callback URI for SLA measurement reports
•	Callback URI for SLA forecast reports
•	Callback URI for SLA breach notifications
Response – The network provider returns an immediate response, which may be one of
•	Request is accepted
•	Invalid request (for example parameters do not match template)
•	Not allowed (for example combination of parameters is not allowed)

Goal – Activate an existing instance of a network slice. All related resources are activated.
Preconditions – The tenant has allocated a network slice instance and has received a Network Slice ID. The network slice instance is not active.
Request – The tenant submits a POST operation to the network slice instance + “/activate” endpoint.
Response – The network provider returns an immediate response, which may be one of
•	Request is accepted
•	Not allowed (for example late binding parameters are missing)

Goal – Activate an existing instance of a network slice. All related resources are activated.
Preconditions – The tenant has allocated a network slice instance and has received a Network Slice ID. The network slice instance is not active.
Request – The tenant submits a POST operation to the network slice instance + “/activate” endpoint.
Response – The network provider returns an immediate response, which may be one of
•	Request is accepted
•	Not allowed (for example late binding parameters are missing)

This interface is used to query performance Metrics such as the delay and traffic of slices.
Queries Metrics based on the slice ID and Metric name and returns the latest Metric values in the system. The returned content includes: Time, value

item.name: API Management

request.description: https://{baseurl}/operations/huawei-sm-access-token:get-token This topic describes how to create the access token required to make calls into the API Management REST API.

item.description: Access to the API Management REST API must be granted before calls can be successfully made.
